website_summaries.verdict: A basic, yet reliable, printer at a budget-friendly price. Hands down the best printer available from Canon for the cash-conscious consumer.
pros: Vivid print quality and reliable wireless connection for a reasonable price
Reliable with fairly quiet printing once installed and online
cons: Some users have issues with set-up, but the online manual can help

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!  All negative reviews are accurate!
customer_reviews.text: JUNK! Should have listened to the reviews! Bluetooth would not connect during initial setup, which I expected based on the reviews and was prepared for. After initial setup using a USB cable, I used it twice before it would no longer connect. Just tried to use again today and surprisingly it connected but would not print because it kept saying it was out of paper. When I finally got the paper feed to pull in paper, it pulled in the ENTIRE STACK. Now it is completely jammed. JUNK! JUNK! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer To Buy If Only Wanting To Print In Black Ink
customer_reviews.text: This is a great All-In-One printer. I like that I can use black ink all by itself. I see no reason to waste colored ink when I'm only printing documents in black. I have another Canon printer but it wasted colored ink because I couldn't print with black alone. This is a waste of money. If you want to print only in black & save colored ink for special needs, then this is the printer to buy. It was very easy to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great for a student on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the price. Been seeing some negative reviews and I'm here to say mine came in great working order. Simple set up if your even a computer novice. Love that i can,control from my phone. Its a bit loud printing, bit its under 50 dollars, you cant expect all that. Its perfect for a student who needs to print/scan/copy quickly and efficiently,
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't think you are the exception!!! BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was different. Better. Smarter. I can certainly out-tech these other reviewers. I will thumb my printed pages at them. I was wrong. I can't out-tech anyone. I'm just the same. No kind of sneetch is the best on the beach. This printer will not format. It was so close, then nothing. It did spew out two configuration tests. So helpful. You have the chance to be better. Smarter. Please, look elsewhere. Beware....beware....(re-read that in your spooky voice)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE
customer_reviews.text: This review isn't about the one that I just bought it is about the one it replaced (Same exact product though). I had it for about 3 years before the power button quit working. I use it at work for scanning and making some copies and I worked it hard, over the course of time I've put 1000's of scans through it and it trudged on and never let me down. So when it came time to replace it I didn't even look at other options, this is the only one I wanted. At this price point it has to be the best value out there for what it does. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This huge thing is the best all in one printer I've owned. I scanned a coloring book to test it and, it captures the bright vibrant colors perfectly. It was worth the $28 price tag. NOTE It's VERY important that you install the cd on your pc first. It gives you specific instructions on how to operate it for the first time with Bluetooth. The manual will NOT give you that information.
customer_reviews.author: XoXSugarSkullXoX

customer_reviews.title: JUNK WIRELESS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer with high hopes, hey, it had a four and a half star rating. But to date, I have not been able to to get it to work wirelesly . it just cant be found by any of my devices or anyone else in my homes wireless devices. I have done every thing the directions have said to do. I am going to send it back. I am very unhappy with it, and can not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: The Edward

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst printer I've ever bought! You will have so much trouble trying to print PDF's and other documents! If you're looking for a basic printer, DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ONE! It's wireless, but if you need to diagnose and repair, you need to be connected via the direct cable, that doesn't come with it! I don't even use it much, because the settings are so complex. It took my scheduling company weeks to figure out a way for me to print my daily work schedule. I have to use the photo print from advanced options just to get it to print. BIG WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Green

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my old printer and wanted to get something without all the cords. Found this very reasonably priced wireless printer and I really like it. Very easy to set up and worked the first time with hardly any effort on my part. I've always been a fan of Canon products and this one did not let me down. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mattyb

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in May 2017 and it is now September 2017. IT NO LONGER WORKS. I even had our IT guy try to fix it. I get it -- they make printers 'disposable' now a days and expect to make their money on the cartridges. I didn't even get a chance to buy replacement cartridges though since it didn't work long enough for that to happen (and I didn't use it enough). One day it started printing uneven. Tried all of the possible repairs (clean, realigning, etc) -- nothing has worked.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Girl

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Canon for making a printer so good at not printing
customer_reviews.text: If a printer could get a 5 star review for jamming, eating paper and never working, this is it. Be ready to spend endless hours making sure this printer doesn't eat paper and keep getting jammed. makes a 2 minute printing job into a 30 minute cluster-fuck. This is my second of these printers since I am a college student and need papers printed all the time. This printer did not actually save me any time because it always jams and I see myself going to the library anyways. Thanks Canon for making a printer so good at not printing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Mix

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, annoying software
customer_reviews.text: Print quality and scans are great. Easily included on network with Windows 10 computers. For the price of the printer and starter cartridges, it was cheaper than replacing just the cartridges in my old (higher-end) printer. Also, I downsized to lighten the load and free up some space in the RV after going full-time. My only complaint (and this is for all printers I've purchased) is why can't I choose to install only the functional software I need? I don't need photo collage software, etc, etc, etc. I can figure out how to disable most of the stuff, but an annoyance nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: rhlogie

customer_reviews.title: The printer product works fine ,but Canon won't register it with the serial numbers on it
customer_reviews.text: I also had trouble with it recognizing my wireless network and had to use a USB cable: ( not included with the printer). The ink bundle ( black 240 and 241 color) costs nearly the same as buying a new printer which really doesn't seem fair or reasonable. The warranty is no good without registration, so they are refusing that. You buy it , they shove you off the cliff without a safety line. Even with it working I gave that deal a one star.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bagula

customer_reviews.title: Really hard to set up WiFi printing with Mac!
customer_reviews.text: This setup brought me back 20 years of just not getting anywhere - I spent 30 minutes with a Canon Tech Support fellow, who was very patient. Here's the trick - If you have a dual band router - one that has 5G and 2G, the printer will default to the lower 2G. If you have your laptop or desktop set to 5G, they won't connect. Luckily, after 1.5 hours, they finally talked to each other. So far, scanning and printing on average paper is meh / not so great. You should consider all the negative reviews - I'm going to keep trying on this a few more times.
customer_reviews.author: GRF

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER I'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 9 months before it bagan printing with a double image. Multiple paper jams, used ink cartridges up in less than an hour sometimes but also gave false error messages about "empty" ink cartridges that were still full of ink. Hours of frustration, reams of paper watsed, this thing is one of the most unholy pieces of garbage I've ever owned. It should be illegal to sell something like this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kupperman

customer_reviews.title: Use the mobile app for setup and you'll be fine
customer_reviews.text: Solid, cheap, wireless printer. Docked a star for terrible setup- tip for anyone having issues connecting to their laptop (I have a macbook): do the initial set up from the mobile app on your phone. It's super easy. Then you can simply add the printer on your laptop. For reference, I build software for a living and I couldn't get their setup wizard to work on my laptop. Just use the mobile app. You'll also need to buy ink. If you set the default to grey scale you can buy just the black and keep the starter color cartridge in place to avoid any low ink errors for those looking to save on ink.
customer_reviews.author: M. Waffles

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different printer
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a lot more complicated than any other printer I've owned but I managed it so it wasn't a big deal. What is a big deal is that it refuses to pick up a sheet of paper and feed it through. I have to physically help it to separate one sheet and then every third or fourth time it jams. Then it promptly forgets what it was supposed to be printing. Not great if you're printing a coupon with a one print limit. Would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Starr

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. The wireless printing worked sporadically from day ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but this one needed it. Horrible product. The wireless printing worked sporadically from day 1. I never did get the tablet or phone wireless printing to work. Once in a while it would work as promised and I could print from my laptop wirelessly. More often than not, my computer would come back "unable to find printer." I would usually just walk my laptop over to the printer and use a cord. Even then it often gave me trouble. After about six months of infrequent use, pieces of the printer broke. Rollers and plastic pieces broke off into the paper tray. I was done and bought an Epson. Never doing Canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Peachnettie

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MG3620 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I really love this printer! It does everything that I would ever want a printer to do. As a matter of fact I liked the printer so much that I have ordered another one just to keep for a spare to replace this one when it stops working. I honestly did have a problem with the first printer after 5 months of heavy use. I had called the Canon service support and they got some information from me and sent me a replacement printer. No problems and the service rep was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: dannyboyinaz

customer_reviews.title: A basic effective functional B/W/Color Printer.
customer_reviews.text: Printer provides what the usual home user requires. It prints & copies. It is WiFi. Print quality is good with enhancement & draft options. Printer has not jammed yet. Ink is reasonably priced. WiFi set up was the most direct & trouble free I have experienced since my first printer in the 80s.
customer_reviews.author: Dale M Williams

customer_reviews.title: Disposable printer does not re-align
customer_reviews.text: This printer has a hard time keeping pages on line ... It is only two months old and it prints jagged across the pages. I've reset it, cleaned it, and done everything I can to fix it but it is useless. It is not worth the money unless you want a "disposable" printer. It worked the first couple of weeks but then, kaput.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Merri Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This printer is cheap in both price and reliability. My use of it was very light and yesterday, in the middle of having to print a holiday newsletter to the family, the paper jammed. Horrible timing! After clearing the paper it continued to jam even though nothing was obstructing it. I ended up buying an HP from Office Depot and got $30 off by trading in the broken Canon. I used to like Canon but quality has suffered. There's a reason this printer is so cheap. Canon simply wants to get something in your office that will need regular printing ink purchases. Now I'm stuck with unused printer cartridges. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery and really easy setup on my iPad Pro
customer_reviews.text: MG3620 delivered within 48 hours and up & running in <30minutes. Starter inks came inside the box. Both starter ink cartridges and the power cord were wrapped up together inside the printer box. As 'starter inks' I am expecting limited printing, which is why I bought the printer/regular ink bundle. You cannot tell if they are 'short pours' by just looking at them, but probably safe to assume. Regardless, the additional ink was delivered the same day as the printer. This was really easy to set up, and you cannot beat the price. Have only printed so far, but will update this review if I have scanning or copying problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mod

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price not
customer_reviews.text: this is a fine printer for the price. do not expect it to handle a lot of work. But if you are making a few copies a day it is fine. Ink is very expensive. Update: This printer cannot handle more than a few copies a day.. I have gone through 3 in the past year. I finally have stopped buying them. They break down in a month or two and anything you try to fix it only helps for a day or two. It's a shame when it's cheaper to keep buying the old bad printer because you have invested in the ink. (which of course cost more than the printer)
customer_reviews.author: Isabelledaddy

customer_reviews.title: Use The App! Heck of a reliable printer
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ignored the negative reviews. Here’s what you need to know: 1. Download the canon print app on your phone. 2. Follow the instructions exactly. 3. Voila your printer is set up on your network. I bought this because our Epson died after 6 faithful years of printing. Update: We have printed hundreds of documents and the printer hasn’t failed us yet. Best printer I could have hoped for for the price. I also buy remanufactured ink cartridges because it ends up being cheaper in the longer run.
customer_reviews.author: Snarky Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Canon Pixma MG3620 only. Great plug and play printer. Installed easily. Print quality is great and it prints two sided by default. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Booher

customer_reviews.title: Good printer except for its boozer problem with ink
customer_reviews.text: Setting this printer up and connecting to the network was a bit of pain. But once that was over, it prints fine. Does multiple copies easily. The real problem I have with the printer is it drinks ink. I had printed what I thought was very little -- some daily to do lists -- before it started cranking at me about being low. I switched to low quality/gray scale to get some more time out of the ink. It also attracts dust. Even if I've just wiped it, it's dusty again. Overall--if the ink situation were better, I would recommend this printer without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good investment and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to setup and connect WiFi perfectly. I was able to connect all three laptops without incident. The only issue was my work one but that is because it needs my company administrator has to add but I had a cord to connect directly and it worked.. The WiFi was tricky but it did connect just took a while to see it on screen to ensure it’s connection. All 3 machines worked.. very happy and the color and scanning was super
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P.

customer_reviews.title: False advertising (IMHO)
customer_reviews.text: I would give this printer 5 stars, after all how can I really complain about a printer/copier/scanner that costs just $5 more than the price of the ink? The thing is this printer claims to be wireless. I can't get Microsoft Windows to recognize this printer. In fact, I had another Canon series printer that claimed to be wireless and Windows could never find it either. So, for the money, its a great value printer, just know if you are using Microsoft Windows, you are going to have to keep it plugged into the USB port if you want to print from your Windows PC. So, I deduct one star.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Complicated installation setup
customer_reviews.text: Set up is a complete hassle. USB cable is not included. Instructions are vague. After two hours of trying different configuration settings, the printer has jammed three times already. The paper trays are of cheap fragile plastic. On the plus side, I appreciate that it came with a black and color cartridges. The installation method that worked for me was through the computer's wi-fi router. If you buy this make sure you have a USB cable as it appears it's the easy way around it. Overall, I'm not sure the price justifies the cheap material and the difficulty to install this printer. This printer looks like it will break by minor day to day use.
customer_reviews.author: Niche17

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little wary because of all the reviewers who had trouble with set up but I thought I'd give it a shot. It did take me some time to set it up..it didn't work through my laptop at first, so I switched to my phone. It took some back and forth on that too, but it finally worked. Now all my devices can find the printer on the network. Print quality is just fine, it does double-sided printing as well, and has a scanner. Seriously, at this price, what more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy the Ink "Bundle"
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THE INK BUNDLE. I don't know how I fell for this. The printer alone comes with 1 color ink and 1 black ink cartridge, and is $40. The ink "bundle" is $50 more and you get an additional... 1 color ink and 1 black ink. You're better off buying an entire additional printer, throwing it away, and keeping the ink. The printer connection to wireless is very strange - I have no idea how it connects to my password-protected wifi network (you don't put the password in during the setup). My prior Canon printer had a screen where you could input the wifi password and it was a lot more intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: M L

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I used a usb cord to set up mine on my windows 10 laptop. Set up was a breeze. It also prints well I only use for the home so it fits my need.
customer_reviews.author: sexy red

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, doesn't take a lot of space, easy to replace the ink.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an old lady printing recipes or correspondence, but having worked for NASA back in the days when every memo had to have 7 copies, and an IBM "ballpoint" typewriter with six sheets of carbon paper was the "fast way to go, this is a miracle!! It has 2 cords, one to get electricity to it, and one so the computer can tell it what to do and where to go. It is a bit noisy (clunky) while printing, but the price and size are just right!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Ricia

customer_reviews.title: LIKE THE PRINTER - HATE THEIR 'TECH SUPPORT"
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my home office. They replaced another (older model) Canon and a H/P. I experienced a problem with wireless installation and called the Canon "Tech Support" line. The heavily-accented technician told me I would have to pay $150 for a solution to my problem. I hung up and muddled through the problem myself. BE WARNED: Tech Support won't be much help unless you've got plenty of cash to spend. I gave the printer(s) four stars because I was able to solve the installation problem myself. I'd give their so-called tech support no stars.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Guy

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: this printer is ridiculously slow and has problems printing, it often just crashes out after 1 to 2 lines on a simple pdf and we have to re-print the entire document. Also you have to install a special driver on your computer to get it to scan, and run the scan from your computer rather than the printer itself- so if you're scanning a multi-page document and your printer isn't right next to your computer, it's quite inconvenient and time consuming. We have actually gone back to using the black and white laser printer I got in 2001 and the scanning apps on our phones rather than using this horrible and inefficient device. That's how bad this is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected to the  computer
customer_reviews.text: The first one did not work The replacement did not work I am now awaiting the replacement for the replacement All the hours spent nearly n the phone with tech support are very frustrating. And the returns are very time consuming
customer_reviews.author: Michael Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Wasted a weekend setting up, printer stopped printing already.
customer_reviews.text: Very confusing experience setting up, still not able to get it to print after almost a week. Support help was hard to access, and even they had trouble solving the problem. Eventually they said I should upload an app on my phone and...woohoo! I was able to print! Once. That was 2 days ago. But today.... back to square one. Almost impossible to reach a human being at CANON. When I finally did, they said I was not registered, so tough. I tried to register, but I was already registered. I will be sending this thing back pronto if I don't get a genie to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Boyd-Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Difficult installation on my laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of difficulty installing this printer and never did get the wireless connection established with my laptop.. Spent several hours on the phone with tech support; issues were resolved when I purchased a USB connecting cable, although I tried multiple times to install the printer before it finally worked. Tech support was generally good but at one point I was told it was my fault the installation was not working. I followed every instruction to the best of my ability and did not appreciate that comment. On the other hand, connecting to my iPad was simple and I was able to print what I needed through that connection.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup for both wireless (with iPhone, iPad and laptop Windows 10) and desktop Windows 10 with USB connection (cable not included but same as my previous Canon). Step by step instructions are intuitive and easy to follow. About 1 hour including app setup. Quick printer response using both methods. Barring future issues you can’t beat the price and quality of this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This is a Canon?
customer_reviews.text: Have never been disappointed buying a Canon printer - till now. You have to use their interface to do everything. No button to copy or scan on the printer itself. To copy you have to scan then print unless I've missed something in their app. Seems the mechanics inside are designed to wear themselves out. It goes through quite an initialization where it clunks, buzzes and churns for some time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Derickson

customer_reviews.title: This printer frustrated the crap out of me so I gave up and off ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer frustrated the crap out of me so I gave up and off it will go to returns. During setup the instructions are worthless. The hint requires a password to connect to it. There is no password to use listed or printed anywhere. What the heck Canon!?! Plus the USB port is not a real USB port. It's some funky thing that doesn't come with it and is useless for mobile devices. Hate this evil thing!
customer_reviews.author: susan greeneisen

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT printer if you like picking paper off of the ground!
customer_reviews.text: It's 2018 and Canon still can't design a printer that prevents printed pages from falling on the floor. If you are trying to print more than 5 pages, expect to pick them up and re-arrange them. Also, if you buy this printer you will become a professional at replacing ink cartridges. Seriously, Canon, an extra 1/4" of plastic on the landing tray would have saved me the time and effort of reviewing this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ochslong

customer_reviews.title: Great small printer at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I did request tech support and have not yet used the touchscreen properties. This is a great little printer at a very reasonable price, and the ink cartridges can be purchased at reasonable cost. Two Problems I had with it: 1) the installation Of ink cartridges is new and can be initially difficult for a new-comer; 2) some difficulty in getting it on WIFI because Window has difficulty in finding Canon MG3600 series.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardette

customer_reviews.title: Wifi is a headache, but quality and duplex is great via USB.
customer_reviews.text: Very good printer for the price, but one star because the wireless is nearly impossible to work right. It will take you hours to connect and the absence of a display to enter Wifi info or access a configuration web page is frustrating. It will not work at 5K, only 2,4; making it useless for me ; using a USB cable (which does not come with it)
customer_reviews.author: uaflyer

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Within 60 days it crapped out. The positive in that? Cannon's tech support was awesome! They sent me a new printer, which I got 4 days later. They knew by the error message i had, so no begging and pleading. If you just want to print and copy it works. I've never used fax ability so can't speak about that. Quality is particularly good! guess what? at ten months it broke again. guess I'm trying another brand
customer_reviews.author: Bre Branco

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a cheap printer
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer I've had in a long time. Six months later and I still can't get the scanner to work, even using a cable. Downloaded all kinds of stuff from Canon, but the scanner still does not work. Quality of the printing is horrible, especially when using color. streaks and gaps all over the page. Paper constantly jams. We always end up having to open it up to pull out paper jams. Seems like we waste more paper on the jams than we actually print on. Canon's customer service is horrible, no help at all. Wish I had just paid a little more for a better printer/scanner because I have to get another one to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: No ink!!
customer_reviews.text: This review (and rating) is not about the printer(which I have not tried), but about the seller. Be extra careful with the your order details. I received the printer without any ink. I did order the “printer only” option, because I interpreted the “+ ink” bundle to mean an extra set of cartridges, however it seems like “printer only” does not include any ink at all and I’ll need to get some ink before I can use the printer. The strange thing is that the box of the printer clearly states that standard cartridges are included... Not very happy of the very unclear and misleading product description.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble with app, needed tech support
customer_reviews.text: I was actually going to leave a 1 star review because I tried for 3 days to hook this up wirelessly to my chromebook. The app the instructions said to download wouldn't work. I kept uninstalling and reinstalling to no avail. I teied printing with a usb chord and it cut off the last couple of lines on every page. I HATED this printer. Luckily, before tossing it out the window, i noticed the instructions had a tech support number for Canon. Duh! Their tech support rocks! All is working great and i am hooked up wirelessly. Only 4 stars, because the instructions could have saved my sanity and stated that the app does not work with chromebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Zanni

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Good to Say
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for school work and light office things at the start of the stay at home orders. Turns out my daughter's work was mostly online, so we used it very lightly. Yet, without "draft" setting this thing sucks up ink. In less than 3 months of light use, the ink is gone. The printer was challenging to sink to my chromebook. Never got the wireless function to work and it didn't come with a cord- had to go out and get that. Never printed straight no matter how many times I went online and ran trouble shooting/alginment steps. Would not reccommend. Looking for a new printer that is better with ink.
customer_reviews.author: Marilee's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: This printer did not connect wirelessly to my mac or tablet only my iPhone, and only once. Then, when printing the second time - the printer wouldn’t recognize device, even with a solid internet signal. I followed all the promptings to set up and to recognize the Bluetooth. Then, to make matters worse, when the printer printed off whatever it prints off during the set up - the paper jammed in the printer and there it sits! Completely unable to use. Of course, I missed the return deadline. Super bummed. I bought this printer in hopes of ease of operations and guaranteed printing without the headache. Bummed it didn’t work as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year, constant problems
customer_reviews.text: I am not a heavy user, I print or scan about once a week at most. this printer is such crap the multipack of ink I bought with it outlasted the printer! After about nine months of use, the paper stopped feeding into the printer. Troubleshooting says to clean the rollers, so i did, and it printed a couple more pages and then just started eating the paper. When I got close up to do a more thorough clean, I noticed they were completely cracked and rotted. Having had a previous Pixma that lasted a decade, I'm furious at the quality lapse.
customer_reviews.author: Hail, Marcabia

customer_reviews.title: If you like wasting time this printer is for you
customer_reviews.text: When I first set up this printer it worked great. Then I moved and had a new internet provider and canon couldn't help me set it up. Tried to blame ATT wireless technology and even told me to look up how to install it on YouTube without even directing me to any particular YouTube video they just told me to look it up. What a joke. Definitely regret this purpose. The software doesn't allow you to control the printer settings I hate the lost minutes dealing with this printer
customer_reviews.author: Biozepp

customer_reviews.title: It prints fine, but man
customer_reviews.text: It prints fine, but man.. so so so many errors pop up and it won't print! When it's out of ink {which happens way too fast} you have to reset it all just to get it to register that you refilled the ink. Then it just randomly won't print from time to time and we have to spend a half hour trying to figure out why. It's terrible. I only gave it 2 stars because the print quality is fine.. if you can get it to print.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: In a Jam
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought this would scan papers and send the pdf to your computer- it doesn't. It will just make another copy. Also, it wouldn't take any papers even though the tray was over half way full. Fiddled with it for an hour until it decided to take the paper- unfortunately it took ALL of the paper instead of just one piece. So now I have a printer with about 30 pieces of paper jammed into it and no way to get all of it out. Sending it back as soon as I figure out how to.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah G.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last September, mainly for the wi-fi capability so i can print from my laptop. It worked great for a week or two, then the wi-fi stopped working. The wi-fi button won't even light up anymore. Tried several trouble shooting suggestions I found on the canon site and internet with no luck. At this point (it is May), it won't even print hooked up manually to my laptop. I spent several hours last night trying to get one page printed out and finally gave up. This was my first Canon and was I not impressed. I will be dumping this and will spend more money on a more reliable printer (most likely not Canon).
customer_reviews.author: EJC

customer_reviews.title: overpriced paperweight
customer_reviews.text: More or less an overpriced paperweight, this is by far one of the cheapest feelings and functioning printers I’ve yet to install. Installation process was by far complicating with very little direction on how to set up Wi-Fi printing. After setting up Wi-Fi printing it only took two days later for the Wi-Fi printing to stop working. This machine was just a giant headache and unless you connected it by USB cord, this printer is otherwise useless. Update: I return this machine
customer_reviews.author: Jon Berrywigg

customer_reviews.title: AIR PRINT OFF YOUR IPHONE / IPAD
customer_reviews.text: Great printer FOR AIR PRINTING from your iPhone / I pad. have to print through a cannon app and use a router or wireless internet signal not too difficult to set up but not totally easy either. Middle of the road ease of use to get it to AIR PRINT FROM APPLE DEVICES, BUT ONCE ITS HOOKED UP ITS AWESOME, PRINTING OUT EMAILS OFF YOUR PHONE IS AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Set up nightmare..
customer_reviews.text: Setup was horrible. I finally called Canon support who got me up and going. So if you purchase, just go ahead and call Canon and they will have you connected quickly. The main reason I chose another Canon was for their customer service. All USA and free. The paper holder that holds the printed paper is very short and bends paper in half. It could be twice as long. So no storing printed jobs. It also cuts off automatically which is inconvenient to have to get up and go turn it on. I am sure there is a setting that will keep it on. At least, I hope so and plan on contacting Canon for this.
customer_reviews.author: K. King

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and is exactly what I wanted. It's compact and easy to work. My feedback from the recipient is that it didn't connect wifi but thinks it because of the bad connection being that he put it in his workshop.
customer_reviews.author: BritBeeTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst printer I have ever bought. The set up process took hours! It was not easy by any means. It constantly shuts off, so when you need it you have to go turn it on. Its loud. Horrible to get the paper out if you get a paper jam so pray you never have one. When I switched network providers I had to go through that whole process of setting up again. Grrr. Then when I finally got it set I get an alarm saying It needs maintenance so call a tech. I bought this in March of 2020. I barely print from it maybe 15x tops! Do not buy this printer!
customer_reviews.author: yogi

customer_reviews.title: Print quality isn't great
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a Canon printer that looked a lot like this one (don't know the model), but it didn't have Wifi. We got this one for the wifi capabilities because my computer isn't near the printer. The wifi works great. But when I compared the same piece of paper printed on his old one and on this new one, the printing quality was SIGNIFICANTLY higher on the old one. When this one prints, the letters don't have clean links. Lots of bleeding and splotchiness. I wish I would have known because I would be happy to pay more for a higher quality print. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Plain Jane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible, but at least its cheap
customer_reviews.text: These show up for $25 sometimes. Printers are horribly frustrating products to use in general, but at least this one is dirt cheap. It'll last a few months, then it'll start showing all sorts of weird problems, then it'll finally just give out. Canon doesn't seem to care to provide any decent products in the space between these dirt cheap printers and something way over budget. I love Canon cameras but man their printers are trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! No computer needed!
customer_reviews.text: Printing from my phone gets paused when it times out and i have multiple print jobs working. Only downside I've had so far. I don't own a computer or laptop just a phone and tablet. I was able to set up the wireless printing with just a little effort. I printed over 100 pages the first day I love it! Great investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria D. Mcginnis

customer_reviews.title: Either Light or Failed printing
customer_reviews.text: This printer never worked well. The prints from the getgo were way too light. I don't print very often so I just dealt with it until it didn't print at all...I replaced both cartridges and then it printed so light you could barely detect it...used the Jarbo brand cartridges if it matters. I've only had this a year, but haven't got a lot of use out of it. Since its been this long though I doubt I could get any kind of refund. Been too busy lately to deal with this sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nubformal

customer_reviews.title: Pretty lame.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda pissed that it doesn't come with ANY ink at all. You spend $39 on a printer.. and then ink on day one is an additional $54 (for black and color). I don't know how I didn't notice that it says PRINTER ONLY and they really mean it! Pretty lame.
customer_reviews.author: Atwater Books

customer_reviews.title: Bought in August, died in January
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these printers from Amazon last August (2018). Last night while I was printing, the paper went in wrong and it jammed. Trying to get the wrinkled paper out, it tore. I final got all the pieces out, I believe and now the output has a white streak running down the center of the pictures. I will NEVER buy a Canon printer again since this is the third one I've had that did this and I am very angry. I just ordered a new Epson to replace it. Don't buy this product. It's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Leon Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Would have retuned this Printer
customer_reviews.text: ts it is meant to print from your phone. It does not work well when printing from your PC. It shuts off all the time and you have to reset it. I bought because the price was right and I do not print very much. That being said you should not have to be a computer whiz to use a printer. I would have returned it but my husband threw out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rose D.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little surprised on how good this printer was. I needed to watch a Youtube video on installing the ink cartridges. They made it look so easy, which it was. My only complaint is that it doesn't automatically sync up to my Chromebook. I tried a couple of times and finally gave up. I do like that it automatically shuts off after a certain amount of time. Energy saving is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Devereux

customer_reviews.title: I installed this printer in under 1 hour, myself (fantastic)
customer_reviews.text: One might say, why so long an install, well it took time to copy files unto my computer, But that was about the most difficult part of the install, It installed just about everything on its own. The start to finish. which included un-taping the printer parts that were taped together. And I printed something on my cell phone without having to do anything. Thank you Canon, You might eventually get me to install Full frame cameras. This was super easy. The competitors' printers stopped working altogether. Purchase Canon. The quality is fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Cox photography

customer_reviews.title: It works, but lots of troubleshooting is required
customer_reviews.text: This is a really low quality (build) printer which randomly refuses to work - a lot. The scanner just decides not to work. There will be an unexplained error message. Recently I figured out that it won’t print wirelessly if the cable to connect via cable to computer is also plugged in (which is an inconvenience to having different people in the house wanting to use it - which brings up another point, it doesn’t seem to want to wirelessly connect to anyone’s computer other than mine). Basically it’s a lot of trouble and time troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Total fail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my personal usage for my last semester of college i needed this so much and i was very disappointed when the printer only worked for 2 days only two days, therefore the paper was clogged inside the printer i try to fix it and watch tutorial and nothing worked i try to installed and desinstalld and still nothing worked the light of error was always on and i could not even use it as a scanner. This is my first time that this happenned to me with a printer i am a designer so i have learned during the years how to work with printers but i couldnt do anything to fix it :(
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 3 hours trying to print something the instructions give you multiple ways to set it up and not one method is easy to follow or even works I tried every method in every way I could think of to no avail! I'm no tech genius but I also have never had such a frustrating experience with a piece of equipment! Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Gehrhardt

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer...
customer_reviews.text: I waited awhile before reviewing and I have say it has passed all tests. I don't do a lot of printing, maybe once a week, but it has been wonderful for printing instructions and Easter / Birthday cards. Easy to set up and I was happy that I was able to program it to turn on and off by itself when sending a job from my computer. I've printed several cards and am still on the ink that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: Text print quality is great. Form factor is perfect for storing away when ...
customer_reviews.text: Text print quality is great. Form factor is perfect for storing away when not in use. PC set-up procedure was terrible. I ended up just setting it up with the iOS app and that worked MUCH better. Why is the first thing it does on the PC set up try to find the printer on the network? Of course, it's not on the network yet... that is what needs to happen! Anyhow, set it up on your phone first, then configure your desktop to work with it... much easier! Image print quality wasn't fantastic... but that can vary a lot with paper, specific ink, etc etc.
customer_reviews.author: William Van Trump

customer_reviews.title: Great compact printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is exactly what I needed! I have a nail polish strip business and needed to be able to print my own shipping labels. This compact printer was super easy to set up and it works perfectly! Images are clear and it prints rather quickly. It's also not very loud. For a smaller printing workload this printer does not disappoint!! I'm happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jen B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: 3rd one I’ve ordered , the price is so affordable and the quality for our needs meets our expectations that I’ve ended up giving them away to family members who needed a printer so I recommend
customer_reviews.author: akdavis

customer_reviews.title: works great but not so easy to install
customer_reviews.text: this printer , once installed works great - i tried installing via wifi but didnt work. You have to have printer usb and connect to your laptop/pc to install the printer and than you can select wifi - all the software will get installed and wifi feature will be turned on / you can then remove the usb cable . Once printer is set up, if you have a 2nd pc and want to connect through wifi , its it easy since the printer is on the netowrk already. can just choose the wifi option and the printer will be installed through wifi.
customer_reviews.author: apopnj

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer scanner copier. Nice price.
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the doubters. They are people who cannot follow instructions. they want to complain about paper jams and all this BS. They think they know more than the people who manufactured the printer. Such ego. Anyway, simply follow the instructions and this is a dynamite printer, scanner, copier. Easy setup and seamless operation on my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Carman

customer_reviews.title: Beware when ordering this Canon printer....Ink was missing
customer_reviews.text: The printer was supposed to come with color and black ink. The ink box was open and EMPTY. Someone removed the ink, the most expensive part of any printer. I feel ripped off. The cost of the printer was $29 plus tax and the cost of the ink lists for $46 or more. Think twice when ordering this printer, it's not worth the ink costs or hassle. Feeling ripped off.....
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sloan

customer_reviews.title: If you're on a budget, the math doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for school use because I figured it would be cheaper than printing for 10 cents a page at school. Turns out I was wrong :( I'm 5 weeks into the semester, have printed less than 100 pages, and I already have to buy replacement toner at $20 per cartridge. Maybe the replacement cartridge will last longer, but given the upfront expense, how long the initial cartridge lasted, and the price of replacement toner, I should have just been printing at school this whole time. Not to mention it's loud as hell, so "night before" assignments either have to be printed in the morning or early in the evening to avoid waking up my housemates.
customer_reviews.author: MissM

customer_reviews.title: Canon  MG3122 Most Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer on Amazon almost 3 years ago. This little machine has been amazing! Prints beautifully, doesn't take up a lot of space and has been trouble free the whole time. I just realized how long I have had it, and how well it has worked out for me and decided to see if I had ever left a review for it. This review is long overdue. I will never hesitate to purchase a Canon product after this. The price I paid for this printer was a lot less than it costs today. Manufacturer must have realized it was worth more. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: LAH

customer_reviews.title: Best printer Ive owned.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best ink cartridge installation and replacement I have ever seen in a printer. Only problem is it takes up a lot of space when printing with all the trays folded out. Other printers I've owned have done better job of keeping everything a but more compact which is convenient when you don't have tons of space.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great! ...if you haven’t updated your OS in 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Uh, what the hell? This piece of garbage only supports very dated operating systems. both my phone and computer are like 5-10 OS’s beyond what this will support.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin B

customer_reviews.title: It Is a Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have had this piece of junk since December. This “wireless” printer has only intermittently printed wirelessly. Fine, okay I can deal with that. Yesterday, the printer decided to no longer have a working paper feed. It ate many sheets of paper while I spent over an hour trying to fix it. It even attempted to eat whole stacks of paper. There is nothing visibly wrong with this hunk of junk. Maybe I can repurpose it as a garbage disposal. Who am I kidding? I want to smash it into tiny bits.
customer_reviews.author: Adee

customer_reviews.title: Works with your phone to print pics off phone or docs. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter asked for this for Christmas to print pictures out. Works great! Pictures look like they were developed in a film store! Ink is about $50 for the 2 cartridges (blk and color). Easy to set up, easy to change cartridges. Would buy again. Works with your phone to print pics or doc off phone wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin b.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer!
customer_reviews.text: So far, works really well! I have always had Canons for their ease of use and cartridges that were not too expensive. Set up was easy. Have not used the wifi feature yet, but was able to set up the app on my phone. I am planning on using it with my new macbook soon and I expect it to be a seamless connection. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA

customer_reviews.title: Decent little printer.
customer_reviews.text: Still think it’s ridiculous the printer is cheaper than replacement ink cartridges. I actually already had this printer, but It ran out of ink and the version I had didn’t have WiFi connectivity, so It’s like I got an upgrade, replacement ink cartridges, and a factory new overhaul for less than it cost to replace the ink. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: light weight that preformed
customer_reviews.text: okay read all the pro and con reviews...decided to order it. Just needed a printer to print. Nothing fancy. it worked for what I needed and I did not to print a whole lot but. Arrived as order on time Prime. Easy to set up. Easy to understand. No Frills, and easy. I will update if things change when i use again.
customer_reviews.author: LBG333

customer_reviews.title: poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Uses too much ink. Actually seems to waste it as it is now indicating that my color cartridge needs to be replaced even though I have been printing gray scale to preserve ink. Printing on two sides causes paper to jam. I have an older HP 7760 printer that I can't buy ink for but it performed better than this printer. Should have kept looking.
customer_reviews.author: Gils Garage

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little printer especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Don't print on anything other than standard paper - not even photo paper
customer_reviews.text: This might have been our mistake but we were trying to print a resume on slightly nicer paper than standard leaf- DO NOT DO THIS. It screwed up the printer alignment and now after trying just about all the tutorials on printer head alignment and how to fix. It won't correct itself. Unfortunately we bought in July 2017 so lifespan of 6 months isn't so great. Usually printers can print on regular paper and card-stock especially since this is supposed to be able to print on photo paper. Not good. If the vendor is out there-would love some advice or feedback or even better, a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked ONCE
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a nice little printer for our random home school worksheets and rare photos. It was very easy to set up, we used it once, it worked fine. Then a month later we went to print 3 documents and nothing but problems with the paper feed, then immediate paper jams. No matter what type of paper we tried, it would struggle to accept it, and once it finally would after dozens of attempts, it would always get stuck. It's a struggle of 2-3 hours just to print out one item. Totally regret purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Aelphae

customer_reviews.title: Good job👍
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality pictures and printed copies 📸📄 very helpful and easy access
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Decent at home printer for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Decent printer for the price, nothing special but gets the job done. I use at home for sporadic printing when I can't use the printer at work. I also like the scanner feature for scanning in books or calendars to print and keep record of. Ink is expenaivelike all printers.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Juliet

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE TECH SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: Even tho I had an Canon account, they (support) could not bring up yet I signed on to get to them! Tried hours (days) to hook up wireless (already had wireless on my old printer set up). It still did not work. Their setup is not correct. Believe me, I have had computers for many years. Be careful, there is a site for Canon that connects you to "someone" who charges over $100 and takes control of your computer. I WOULD NOT BUY! AMAZON (thank goodness) for them is refunding my money. Lesson learned. Read more reviews same thing!
customer_reviews.author: Peace

customer_reviews.title: Ink Carts Run Our Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I hardly print at all and I have run out of ink in both cartridges already after 3 months. Bit of a ripoff since that's where you spend the money. Otherwise the printer itself works well and quality is fine. Have not printed photos yet so can't speak to that. Thee wireless feature is nice and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most expensive printer, but so far does everything I need it to at good quality. Good printing speed, good scans, etc. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Nice but recommend to use in concert with a quality laser printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer produces gorgeous pictures on HP photo paper. It also prints well on card stock. BUT I would NOT purchase this as a primary printer. It is slow, noisy, and ink is very expensive. I have a Dell color laser printer as my default printer which cost around $100 and ink is much cheaper. Unfortunately, you really need an ink jet printer to print on photo paper or card stock, so this does the trick. Had no problem connecting to wireless on my Dell desktop. Recommend that you purchase this only for the limited usage on photos and cards/card stock.
customer_reviews.author: K. Colvin

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - Died a horrible death!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a RED all-in-one CANON MG3620 with matching RED fabric (no tangle) USB cable! ...(-; Even though plastics should plastics, the lid (that covers the flat bed scanner) will scratch even from YOUR fingernail - mega boo there for sure! Otherwise this printer is a sight to see in motion! Watch the "Duplex Mode" (prints BOTH sides of the paper - really!) Be sure to extend both paper catchers fully...BTW, you have to select the duplex mode each time - doesn't default... Lastly, you are going to pay big bucks for the 241XL color and the 240XL black, but you knew that!
customer_reviews.author: PepperM

product_meta.title: Canon Pixma MG3620 Wireless All-In-One Color Inkjet Printer with Mobile and Tablet Printing, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:PrinterWireless all in one printer with scanner and copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing with Airprint and Google Cloud Print compatible. OS Compatibility - Windows:19 Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, Windows 7 SP1, Windows Vista SP1, Vista SP2, Windows XP SP3 32-bit ,Mac:20 Mac OS X v10.7.5 - 10.10.
feature_bullets: Mobile Device Printing: Easily print from your iPhone, iPad, Android or tablet
Powerful Printing options: Airprint, Google Cloud Print, NFC, Mopria and Canon Print
Print on both sides of the page with Auto 2-sided Print

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars8,368 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
